findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RED - Redudant Event Declaration
findings.description: The event `MinTokensBeforeSwapUpdated` is declared and not being used in the contract, making it redundant.

findings.title: AOI - Arithmetic Operations Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract uses both SafeMath library and native arithmetic operations, which can introduce inconsistencies and undermine safety measures.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the variable `numTokensSellToAddToLiquidity` can trigger a huge amount of token swaps, leading to significant price volatility due to the token's highly volatile price.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, leading to redundant storage writes and unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments which can lead to issues like gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability of the source code.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide recommends adhering to a set of guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code, including using camelCase for function and variable names, PascalCase for contract, struct, and enum names, uppercase for constant variables and enums, proper indentation, spaces between operators and after commas, and comments to explain the purpose and behavior of the code.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.
